Posts.Content: My Dad is two rounds into chemotherapy after hormone therapy and radiation proved to lose their effectiveness. PSA levels have ranged from within the normal bands to as a high as as 80 at its peak. While hormone therapy managed to bring these levels down significantly, chemo has been opted for. He is experiencing intermittent stomach pains that last for a day or so then seem to abate. While the pain has not been chronic, his doctors haven't been too forthcoming as to whether this is to be expected. Is this normal? Anything that can be done to alleviate it?
Posts.Title: Stomach pains
